title: Vehicle Overview
content:
# McLaren 720S Overview

The McLaren 720S is a mid-engine sports car produced by McLaren Automotive. It is the second car in the McLaren Super Series, replacing the 650S beginning in 2017.

## Key Specifications

| Specification | Value |
|---------------|-------|
| Engine | 4.0L twin-turbo V8 |
| Power | 710 hp (720 PS) |
| Torque | 568 lb-ft |
| 0-60 mph | 2.8 seconds |
| Top Speed | 212 mph |

## Safety Precautions

> **Warning**: Always ensure the vehicle is properly secured before performing any maintenance procedures.

### Before Starting Work

1. Park on level ground
2. Engage parking brake
3. Disconnect battery (negative terminal first)
4. Allow engine to cool completely

## Engine Bay Access

To access the engine bay:

```bash
# Emergency engine bay release sequence
1. Locate release handle in cabin
2. Pull handle while pressing hood release
3. Lift hood using support struts
```

![Engine Bay](https://via.placeholder.com/600x300?text=Engine+Bay+Diagram)
*Figure 1: Engine bay layout diagram*

title: Technical Specifications
content:
# Technical Specifications

## Engine

The McLaren 720S features a 4.0-liter twin-turbocharged V8 engine.

### Engine Specifications

| Component | Specification |
|-----------|---------------|
| Displacement | 3,994 cc |
| Configuration | V8, 90Â° |
| Valvetrain | DOHC, 4 valves per cylinder |
| Compression Ratio | 10.5:1 |
| Fuel System | Direct injection |

### Performance Data

- **Maximum Power**: 710 hp @ 7,500 rpm
- **Maximum Torque**: 568 lb-ft @ 5,500 rpm
- **Redline**: 8,500 rpm

## Transmission

7-speed seamless shift dual-clutch transmission (SSG)

### Gear Ratios

```
1st: 3.166
2nd: 2.050
3rd: 1.481
4th: 1.166
5th: 0.973
6th: 0.816
7th: 0.689
Reverse: 2.300
```

## Suspension

Adaptive dampers with three driving modes:

1. **Comfort**: Optimized for daily driving
2. **Sport**: Enhanced handling characteristics
3. **Track**: Maximum performance setup

![Suspension Diagram](https://via.placeholder.com/600x400?text=Suspension+Components)
*Figure 2: Suspension system overview*

title: Diagnostic Trouble Codes
content:
# Diagnostic Trouble Codes

## OBD-II Port Location

The OBD-II diagnostic port is located under the dashboard on the driver's side.

## Common Codes

### Engine Codes

| Code | Description | Severity |
|------|-------------|----------|
| P0300 | Random cylinder misfire | High |
| P0171 | System too lean (Bank 1) | Medium |
| P0174 | System too lean (Bank 2) | Medium |
| P0420 | Catalyst efficiency below threshold | Low |

### Transmission Codes

| Code | Description | Action Required |
|------|-------------|----------------|
| P0700 | Transmission control system | Scan TCM |
| P0715 | Input/turbine speed sensor | Replace sensor |
| P0720 | Output speed sensor | Check wiring |

## Diagnostic Procedure

### Step 1: Connect Scanner

```bash
# Scanner connection procedure
1. Turn ignition to ON position (do not start)
2. Connect OBD scanner to port
3. Follow scanner prompts
4. Record all active and pending codes
```

### Step 2: Code Analysis

> **Important**: Always clear codes after repairs and test drive to confirm fix.

1. Look up code definitions
2. Check for multiple related codes
3. Verify with known symptoms
4. Consult wiring diagrams if needed

![Diagnostic Port](https://via.placeholder.com/400x300?text=OBD+Port+Location)
*Figure 3: OBD-II port location*

title: Main Wiring Harness
content:
# Main Wiring Harness

## Safety First

> **Danger**: Always disconnect battery before working on electrical systems.

### Required Tools

- Digital multimeter
- Wire strippers
- Heat shrink tubing
- Soldering iron
- Electrical tape

## Harness Layout

The main wiring harness runs from the front electrical center to the rear of the vehicle.

### Primary Connections

1. **Engine Bay Junction**
   - ECU connections
   - Sensor power distribution
   - Ground points

2. **Cabin Distribution**
   - Dashboard electronics
   - Interior lighting
   - Climate control

3. **Rear Section**
   - Tail light assembly
   - Fuel pump
   - Rear sensors

## Wire Color Codes

| Color | Function |
|-------|----------|
| Red | 12V Power |
| Black | Ground |
| Blue | Signal |
| Yellow | Switched Power |
| Green | Data |
| White | Lighting |

## Testing Procedures

### Continuity Test

```bash
# Multimeter continuity check
1. Set meter to continuity mode (beep)
2. Touch probes to wire ends
3. Listen for beep (good connection)
4. No beep = open circuit
```

### Voltage Test

```bash
# Voltage measurement
1. Set meter to DC voltage
2. Black probe to ground
3. Red probe to wire
4. Compare to specification
```

![Wiring Diagram](https://via.placeholder.com/800x600?text=Wiring+Harness+Diagram)
*Figure 4: Main wiring harness routing*

title: Vehicle Overview
content:
# McLaren 650S Overview

The McLaren 650S is a British sports car designed and manufactured by McLaren Automotive. It was announced in 2014 as a new model, but based on the existing MP4-12C.

## Key Features

- Carbon fiber monocoque chassis
- Active aerodynamics
- Adaptive suspension
- Launch control system

### Performance Highlights

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Power | 641 hp |
| Torque | 500 lb-ft |
| 0-62 mph | 3.0 seconds |
| Top Speed | 207 mph |

## Getting Started

Before performing any maintenance:

1. Review safety procedures
2. Gather required tools
3. Ensure proper workspace
4. Check service bulletins

> **Note**: Always refer to the latest technical service bulletins for updates.

![650S Profile](https://via.placeholder.com/600x300?text=McLaren+650S)
*Figure 1: McLaren 650S side profile*
